title: Liam Payne admits competition between One Direction stars amid chart battle
text:
Liam Payne is gearing up to release debut album LP1 in December (Picture: PA)

Liam Payne admits there is competition with his One Direction bandmates as they all do battle in the charts.

The Strip That Down singer is getting ready to finally release his debut album, after keeping us all waiting for a good few years.

And the 26-year-old revealed that, despite going down a different musical path than Louis Tomlinson, Harry Styles and Niall Horan, there is still some rivalry between them all.

Speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk on the red carpet at Kiss Haunted House Party, he told us: ‘There’s definitely some sort of competition there, for sure.

‘But at the same time, how do you judge us against each other when everything’s so different? It’s like trying to put me next to an artist that’s like John Mayer at the same time. The songs are completely worlds apart.

‘Although we’re boys of the same age, from a group where we were all the same, we started the same, there is that part of it… But then also the music is so different you can’t really make a judgement.’

Liam admitted there was competition between the One Direction boys (Picture: Getty)

While there might be ‘competition’ between them all, Liam revealed they are all still close friends.

When asked if they had ‘wished him well’, the dad-of-one continued: ‘Yeah, definitely. I speak to Louis all the time. Louis is great. He recently just put something out, which is great. He’s doing really well.

‘We’ve always had a good connection in the way we were trying to manage the band together. And that’s followed through into life in that way. He’s obviously been through a hell of a lot so I tried to be there for him as much as possible, and so does he, me.

‘It’s good to have someone who’s been through the same [things] you have.’

Liam Payne and Louis Tomlinson have always remained close (Picture: Rex)

Liam recently announced his debut album, aptly titled LP1, will be with us on 6 December.

Lifting the lid on what we can expect from his offering, the Bedroom Floor star explained it’s a real mixed bag.

‘There’s a good mix of songs,’ he said. ‘There are some that are quite new age, some that are more like albums I used to listen to when I was a kid, like Usher 8701, Justified by Justin Timberlake, and it’s an old school Chris Brown mix.

‘It’s quite funny that they’re the first albums I listened to as a kid.

‘I mean, it was a little bit slow to start off with. I feel like, not in a cheesy way, but I got a little bit too close to the project. And I listened to everything so much that I was like, “I don’t even know whether this is good anymore. I’ve got no parameter.”

‘So I gave it some time, and when I came back around to listen to it again, I was like, “I think he’s ready now.” It just took a little bit of time.’

Well, 6 December can’t come soon enough.
